subject: Relationships
title: When Friendships Fade: The Slow Goodbye
description: A quick, practical guide to When Friendships Fade: The Slow Goodbye.

hook.text: There's no breakup. No fight. One day you realize you haven't spoken in two years. The friendship just faded.

buildup.text: Most friendships end not with conflict but with gradual fading â€” life changes, moves, competing priorities.

discovery.text: We replace half our close friends every seven years. The social circle is constantly, silently regenerating.

twist.text: Grieving a faded friendship feels silly â€” there's no event to mourn. But the loss is real and often deep.

climax.text: Some friendships end because they should. Others end because nobody fought to keep them. Knowing the difference matters.

punchline.text: Most friendships don't end with a fight. They end with silence.

quiz.question: How often do we replace half our close friends?
